subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Scientists Who Believe: Faith in the Lab
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Scientists Who Believe: Faith in the Lab.

hook.text: Francis Collins led the Human Genome Project and is an evangelical Christian. He sees no conflict. Many peers agree.

buildup.text: Surveys show about 40% of scientists believe in a personal God. The number has barely changed in a century.

discovery.text: Collins argues the genetic code points to a God of elegant order. The more he learns, the more he believes.

twist.text: Believing scientists face pressure from both sides: atheist peers mock them; religious peers distrust their science.

climax.text: 40% of scientists believe in God. The idea that knowledge kills faith is a myth. Many live comfortably in both worlds.

punchline.text: 40% of scientists believe in God. Knowledge doesn't automatically kill faith.

quiz.question: What percentage of scientists believe in a personal God?
